thread.title: Manchester United stars 'face 25 per cent pay cut' if Red Devils fail to qualify for Champions League again
thread.title_full: Manchester United stars 'face 25 per cent pay cut' if Red Devils fail to qualify for Champions League again

author: James Whaling
title: Manchester United stars 'face 25 per cent pay cut' if Red Devils fail to qualify for Champions League again
text:
Sport Manchester United stars 'face 25 per cent pay cut' if Red Devils fail to qualify for Champions League again Stars who were at Old Trafford last term lost out on money from this season's wage after a fifth-placed finish under Louis van Gaal Share Pogba and Zlatan could be among those to lose money from their pay packets (Photo: Getty Images) Share Get Manchester United FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Manchester United stars will reportedly lose a chunk of their wages if the Red Devils fail to qualify for the Champions League again this season. 
Players face losing up to 25 per cent of their pay packet should United miss out on the top four, report The Sun. 
Stars who were at Old Trafford last term lost out on money from this season's wage after a fifth-placed finish under Louis van Gaal. 
And the likes of Zlatan Ibrahimovic and Paul Pogba, who arrived over the summer, will suffer the same fate for another failure in the current campaign. Rooney, celebrating his 250th goal, was among those to miss out on the top four last term (Photo: Tom Purslow) Mourinho is attempting to restore United's place at Europe's top table (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) 
Pogba earns £290,000-a-week at United following his world-record £89million switch from Juventus, £70,000 more than Ibrahimovic. 
While the likes of Arsenal and Manchester City add to their players' wages for a top-four finish, United deduct for failure to reach Europe's top table. 
The club have already confirmed that the kit deal with Adidas will be slashed by 30 per cent, around £22.5million, for a second consecutive season out of the Champions League. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
